jQuery add() Method



Example

Add <p> and <span> elements to an existing group of elements (<h1>):

This example adds the same css style for both p and span elements, 
as the existing h1 element.

$("h1").add("p").add("span")


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script 
src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!-- w    w w .   d e  m  o  2    s.    c  o m -->
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  $("h1").add("p").add("span").css("background-color", "yellow");
});
</script>

</head>
<body>

<h1>Welcome</h1>
<p>A p element.</p>
<p>Another p element.</p>

<span>A span element.</span>
<span>A span element.</span><br><br>

</body>
</html>



Description

The add() method adds elements to an existing group of elements.

This method adds elements on the whole document, or just inside context 
elements if the context parameter is specified.


Syntax


$(selector).add(element,context)




Parameter   Description



element



   Required.                                           
   Element to be added to an existing group of elements
   Can be:                                             
    a selector expression,                             
    a jQuery object,                                   
    one or more elements or                            
    an HTML snippet                                    


context   Optional.                                          
   where the selector expression should begin matching




Example

Add a dom element.

Add a <span> element to an existing group of <p> elements, by using a reference to a DOM element.

$("p").add(document.getElementsByTagName("span")[0])
        .css("background-color", "yellow");


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script 
src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!-- w  w    w.    d e  m  o 2    s  .  co  m  -->
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  $("p").add(document.getElementsByTagName("span")[0])
        .css("background-color", "yellow");
});
</script>

</head>
<body>

<p>A p element.</p>
<p>Another p element.</p>

<span>A span element.</span>
<span>A span element.</span><br><br>

<div>This example adds the same css style for the first span 
element (index 0), as the existing p elements.</div>

</body>
</html>


Add HTML snippet

Using an HTML snippet to add a <span> element to an existing <p> element.

$("p").add("<br><span>A new span element.</span>").appendTo("p");


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script 
src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!--   w w w   .  d  e  m  o  2 s    . c   o  m-->
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  $("button").click(function(){
    $("p").add("<br><span>A new span element.</span>").appendTo("p");
  });
});
</script>

</head>
<body>

<button>Add a span element</button>

<p>A p element.</p>

</body>
</html>




jQuery addClass() Method



Example

Add a class name to the first <p> element:

$(document).ready(function(){
  $("button").click(function(){
    $("p:first").addClass("intro");
  });
});


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script 
src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!--   w  ww    .  d e m    o2  s  .   c o  m  -->
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  $("button").click(function(){
    $("p:first").addClass("intro");
  });
});
</script>
<style>
.intro {
  font-size: 150%;
  color: red;
}
</style>
</head>
<body>

<h1>This is a heading</h1>

<p>This is a paragraph.</p>
<p>This is another paragraph.</p>

<button>test</button>

</body>
</html>



Description

The addClass() method adds one or more class names to the selected elements.

This method does not remove existing class attributes, it only adds one or more class names to the class attribute.

To add more than one class, separate the class names with spaces.


Syntax


$(selector).addClass(classname,function(index,current_class))




Parameter   Description



classname   Required.                          
   one or more class names to be added


function(index,current_class)    Optional.                                                 
   a function that returns one or more class names to be added



function(index,current_class) has the following parameter:




Item   Description



index   Returns the index position of the element in the set


current_class   Returns the current class name of the selected element




Example

Add two class names to a specified element.

$(document).ready(function(){
  $("button").click(function(){
    $("p:first").addClass("intro note");
  });
});


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script 
src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!--   w  ww  .    de    m  o 2   s.  c   o   m-->
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  $("button").click(function(){
    $("p:first").addClass("intro note");
  });
});
</script>
<style>
.intro {
  font-size: 30px;
  color: blue;
}
.note {
  background-color: yellow;
}
</style>
</head>
<body>

<h1>This is a heading</h1>

<p>This is a paragraph.</p>
<p>This is another paragraph.</p>

<button>Add two class names to the first p element</button>

</body>
</html>


Add classes to selected elements using a function.

$(document).ready(function(){
  $("button").click(function(){
    $("p").addClass(function(n){
      return "par_" + n;
    });
  });
});


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script 
src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!-- w    w  w .   d  em  o   2   s .   co    m-->
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  $("button").click(function(){
    $("p").addClass(function(n){
      return "par_" + n;
    });
  });
});
</script>
<style>
.par_0 {
  color: blue;
}
.par_1 {
  color: red;
}
</style>
</head>
<body>

<h1>This is a heading</h1>

<p>This is a paragraph.</p>
<p>This is another paragraph.</p>

<button>Add classes to p elements</button>

</body>
</html>


Use addClass() and removeClass() to remove one class name, and add a new class name.

$(document).ready(function(){
  $("button").click(function(){
    $("p:last").removeClass("intro").addClass("main");
  });
});


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script 
src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!--  w   ww   .   d e m    o 2  s   .c  o  m  -->
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  $("button").click(function(){
    $("p:last").removeClass("intro").addClass("main");
  });
});
</script>
<style>
.intro {
  color: red;
}
.main {
  background-color: yellow;
}
</style>
</head>
<body>

<h1>This is a heading</h1>

<p>This is another paragraph.</p>
<p class="intro">This is a paragraph.</p>

<button>Change class name of the last p element</button>

</body>
</html>




jQuery after() Method



Example

Insert content after each <p> element:

$(document).ready(function(){
  $("button").click(function(){
    $("p").after("<p>Hello world!</p>");
  });
});


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script 
src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!--   w w  w .   d  e m   o   2  s.    co    m-->
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  $("button").click(function(){
    $("p").after("<p>Hello world!</p>");
  });
});
</script>
</head>
<body>

<button>Insert content after each p element</button>

<p>This is a paragraph.</p>
<p>This is another paragraph.</p>

</body>
</html>



Description

The after() method inserts specified content after the selected elements.

To insert content before selected elements, use the before() method.


Syntax


$(selector).after(content,function(index))




Parameter   Description



content


   Required.                                    
   the content to insert, for example, HTML tags
   Possible values:                             
   HTML elements                                
   jQuery objects                               
   DOM elements                                 


function(index)   a function that returns the content to insert               
   index - Returns the index position of the element in the set




Example

Insert content with the after() method.

function afterText() {
  let txt1 = "<b>I </b>";           // Create element with HTML
  let txt2 = $("<i></i>").text("love ");  // Create with jQuery
  let txt3 = document.createElement("b");   // Create with DOM
  txt3.innerHTML = "jQuery!";
  $("img").after(txt1, txt2, txt3);    // Insert new elements after img
}


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script 
src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!--  w w    w  .  d  em   o 2  s   .  c o   m -->
<script>
function afterText() {
  let txt1 = "<b>I </b>";           // Create element with HTML
  let txt2 = $("<i></i>").text("love ");  // Create with jQuery
  let txt3 = document.createElement("b");   // Create with DOM
  txt3.innerHTML = "jQuery!";
  $("img").after(txt1, txt2, txt3);    // Insert new elements after img
}
</script>
</head>
<body>

<img src="html.png" alt="jQuery" width="100" height="140">

<p>Click the button to insert text after the image.</p>

<button onclick="afterText()">Insert after</button>

</body>
</html>


Use a function to insert content after selected elements.

$(document).ready(function(){
  $("button").click(function(){
    $("p").after(function(n){
      return "<div>The p element above has index " + n + ".</div>";
    });
  });
});


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script 
src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!--   w  w w .  d   e  m  o  2   s.   c o    m-->
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  $("button").click(function(){
    $("p").after(function(n){
      return "<div>The p element above has index " + n + ".</div>";
    });
  });
});
</script>
</head>
<body>

<h1>This is a heading</h1>

<p>This is a paragraph.</p>
<p>This is another paragraph.</p>
<p>This is another paragraph.</p>

<button>Insert content after each p element</button>

</body>
</html>




jQuery ajax() Method



Example

Change the text of a <div> element using an AJAX request:

$(document).ready(function(){
  $("button").click(function(){
    $.ajax({url: "ajax.txt", success: function(result){
      $("#div1").html(result);
    }});
  });
});


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script
 src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!--   w w  w .  d  e    m o  2   s.    c o   m-->
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  $("button").click(function(){
    $.ajax({url: "ajax.txt", success: function(result){
      $("#div1").html(result);
    }});
  });
});
</script>
</head>
<body>

<div id="div1">
<h3>Let jQuery AJAX Change This Text</h3></div>

<button>Get External Content</button>

</body>
</html>



Description

The ajax() method makes an asynchronous HTTP request or AJAX call.

All jQuery AJAX methods use the ajax() method. 

This method is used for requests where the other methods cannot be used.


Syntax


$.ajax({name:value, name:value, ... })

The parameters specifies one or more name/value pairs for the AJAX request.

Possible names/values in the table below:




Name   Type   Description



async     Boolean      
   Default is true		   indicating whether the request should be handled asynchronous or not.


beforeSend(xhr)   function   run before the request is sent


cache     Boolean      
   Default is true		   indicating whether the browser should cache the requested pages.


complete(xhr,status)   function   run when the request is finished (after success and error functions)


contentType   String   The content type used when sending data to the server.
    Default is: "application/x-www-form-urlencoded"      


context   Object   Sets the "this" value for all AJAX related callback functions


data   Object   Sets data to be sent to the server


dataFilter(data,type)   function   handle the raw response data of the XMLHttpRequest


dataType   String   The data type expected of the server response.


error(xhr,status,error)   function   to run if the request fails.


global     Boolean value
   Default is true		   whether or not to trigger global AJAX event handles for the request.


ifModified   Boolean value       
     Default is: false.		   whether a request is only successful if the response has changed since the last request.


jsonp   string   overriding the callback function in a jsonp request


jsonpCallback   String   Sets a name for the callback function in a jsonp request


password   String   Sets a password in an HTTP access authentication request.


processData   Boolean value   
    Default is true		   whether or not data sent with the request should be transformed into a query string.


scriptCharset   String   Sets the charset for the request


success(result,status,xhr)   function   run when the request succeeds


timeout   Number   The local timeout in milliseconds for the request


traditional   Boolean value   whether or not to use the traditional style of param serialization


type     String     
   (GET or POST)		   Sets the type of request.


url   String   Sets the URL to send the request to.
    Default is the current page        


username   String   a username to be used in an HTTP access authentication request


xhr   function   creating the XMLHttpRequest object




Example

Use the async setting to specify a synchronous request

$(document).ready(function(){
  $("button").click(function(){
    $.ajax({url: "ajax.txt", async: false, success: function(result){
      $("div").html(result);
    }});
  });
});


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script
 src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!-- w   w w    . d   em  o   2   s  .  c  o m -->
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  $("button").click(function(){
    $.ajax({url: "ajax.txt", async: false, success: function(result){
      $("div").html(result);
    }});
  });
});
</script>
</head>
<body>

<div><h3>Let AJAX change this text</h3></div>

<button>Change Content</button>

</body>
</html>


Make an AJAX request with a specified data type

use the dataType setting to specify the data type for the request.


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script
 src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script>
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  $("button").click(function(){
    $.ajax({url: "demo_ajax_script.js", dataType: "script"});
  });
});
</script>
</head>
<body>

<button>Use Ajax to get and then run a JavaScript</button>

</body>
</html>


Make an AJAX request with an error

Use the error setting to deal with errors in an AJAX request.

$(document).ready(function(){
  $("button").click(function(){
    $.ajax({url: "wrongfile.txt", error: function(xhr){
      document.getElementById('demo').innerHTML = 
        "An error occured: " + xhr.status + " " + xhr.statusText;
    }});
  });
});


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script
src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!--  w   w w   . d e    m o  2 s    .c   o  m -->
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  $("button").click(function(){
    $.ajax({url: "wrongfile.txt", error: function(xhr){
      document.getElementById('demo').innerHTML = 
         "An error occured: " + xhr.status + " " + xhr.statusText;
    }});
  });
});
</script>
</head>
<body>
<p id='demo'></p>
<div></div>

<button>test</button>

</body>
</html>




jQuery ajaxComplete() Method



Example

Show an image while an AJAX request is going on:

$(document).ready(function(){
  $(document).ajaxStart(function(){
    $("#wait").css("display", "block");
  });
  $(document).ajaxComplete(function(){
    $("#wait").css("display", "none");
  });
  $("button").click(function(){
    $("#txt").load("ajax.txt");
  });
});


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script
 src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!--  w   ww    .  d e  m   o 2 s  .  c   o   m-->
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  $(document).ajaxStart(function(){
    $("#wait").css("display", "block");
  });
  $(document).ajaxComplete(function(){
    $("#wait").css("display", "none");
  });
  $("button").click(function(){
    $("#txt").load("ajax.txt");
  });
});
</script>
</head>
<body>

<div id="txt"><h3>Let AJAX change this text</h3></div>

<button>Change Content</button>

<div id="wait"
     style="display:none;width:69px;height:89px;
            border:1px solid black;position:absolute;
            top:50%;left:50%;padding:2px;">
     <img src='css.png' width="64" height="64" /><br>Loading..</div>

</body>
</html>



Description

The ajaxComplete() method runs a function when an AJAX request completes.

This method should attach to document.

The functions set with the ajaxComplete() method 
will run when the request is completed regardless, even when it is not successful.


Syntax


$(document).ajaxComplete(function(event,xhr,options))




Parameter   Description


function(event,xhr,options)   Required.                                          
   Sets the function to run when the request completes

Additional parameters:




Item   Description



event   contains the event object


xhr   contains the XMLHttpRequest object


options   contains the options used in the AJAX request





jQuery ajaxError() Method



Example

inform user when an AJAX request fails:

$(document).ready(function(){
  $(document).ajaxError(function(){
      document.getElementById('demo').innerHTML = "An error occured!";
  });
  $("button").click(function(){
      $("div").load("wrongfile.txt");
  });
});


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script
 src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!--   w w w   .  d  e   m o   2s   . c    om  -->
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  $(document).ajaxError(function(){
      document.getElementById('demo').innerHTML = "An error occured!";
  });
  $("button").click(function(){
      $("div").load("wrongfile.txt");
  });
});
</script>
</head>
<body>
<p id='demo'></p>
<div><h3>Let AJAX change this text</h3></div>

<button>Change Content</button>

</body>
</html>



Description

The ajaxError() method runs a function when an AJAX request fails.

This method should attach to document.


Syntax


$(document).ajaxError(function(event,xhr,options,exc))




Parameter   Description


function(event,xhr,options,exc)   Required.                                    
   Sets the function to run if the request fails

Additional parameters: 




Item   Description



event   the event object


xhr   the XMLHttpRequest object


options   the options used in the AJAX request


exc   the JavaScript exception, if one occurred




Example

Use the options parameter to get a more useful error message.

$(document).ready(function(){
  $(document).ajaxError(function(e, xhr, opt){
       document.getElementById('demo').innerHTML = 
            "Error requesting " + 
            opt.url + ": " + 
            xhr.status + " " + xhr.statusText);
  });
  $("button").click(function(){
    $("div").load("wrongfile.txt");
  });
});


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script 
src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!--  w w    w .   d  e m  o   2  s.  c  o    m-->
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  $(document).ajaxError(function(e, xhr, opt){
       document.getElementById('demo').innerHTML = 
            "Error requesting " + 
            opt.url + ": " + 
            xhr.status + " " + xhr.statusText);
  });
  $("button").click(function(){
    $("div").load("wrongfile.txt");
  });
});
</script>
</head>
<body>
<p id='demo'></p>
<div><h3>Let AJAX change this text</h3></div>

<button>Change Content</button>

</body>
</html>




jQuery ajaxSend() Method



Example

Change the content of a <div> element when an AJAX requests is about to be sent:

$(document).ready(function(){
  $(document).ajaxSend(function(e, xhr, opt){
    $("div").append("<p>Requesting " + opt.url + "</p>");
  });
  $("button").click(function(){
    $("div").load("ajax.txt");
  });
});


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script 
  src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!--   w  w w .    de  m    o  2 s  . c  o  m  -->
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  $(document).ajaxSend(function(e, xhr, opt){
      $("div").append("<p>Requesting " + opt.url + "</p>");
  });
  $("button").click(function(){
      $("div").load("ajax.txt");
  });
});
</script>
</head>
<body>

<div><h3>Let AJAX change this text</h3></div>

<button>Change Content</button>

</body>
</html>



Description

The ajaxSend() method runs a function when an AJAX requests is about to send.

This method should only be attached to document.


Syntax


$(document).ajaxSend(function(event,xhr,options))




Parameter   Description


function(event,xhr,options)   Required.                                       
   Sets the function to run if the request succeeds

Additional parameters: 




Item   Description



event   the event object


xhr   the XMLHttpRequest object


options   the options used in the AJAX request





jQuery ajaxSetup() Method



Example

Set the default URL and success function for all AJAX requests:

$(document).ready(function(){
  $("button").click(function(){
    $.ajaxSetup({url: "ajax.txt", success: function(result){
      $("div").html(result);}});
    $.ajax();
  });
});


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script 
src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!--  w   w w  . d  e    mo   2  s .  c  o   m -->
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  $("button").click(function(){
    $.ajaxSetup({url: "ajax.txt", success: function(result){
      $("div").html(result);}});
    $.ajax();
  });
});
</script>
</head>
<body>

<div><h3>Let AJAX change this text</h3></div>

<button>Change Content</button>

</body>
</html>



Description

The ajaxSetup() method sets default values for AJAX requests.


Syntax


$.ajaxSetup({name:value, name:value, ... })

The parameters specifies the settings for AJAX requests with one or more name/value pairs.

Possible names/values in the table below:




Name   Type   Description



async     Boolean value
   Default is true		   whether the request should be handled asynchronous or not.


beforeSend(xhr)   function   run before the request is sent


cache      Boolean value
   Default is true 		   whether the browser should cache the requested pages.


complete(xhr,status)   function   run when the request is finished (after success and error functions)


contentType   String   The content type used when sending data to the server.
      Default is: "application/x-www-form-urlencoded"    


context   Object   Sets the "this" value for all AJAX related callback functions


data   Object   Sets data to be sent to the server


dataFilter(data,type)   function   handle the raw response data of the XMLHttpRequest


dataType   String   The data type expected of the server response.


error(xhr,status,error)   function   run if the request fails.


global     Boolean value
   Default is true		   whether or not to trigger global AJAX event handles for the request.


ifModified    Boolean value    
   Default is: false.		   whether a request is only successful if the response has changed since the last request.


jsonp   string   the callback function in a jsonp request


jsonpCallback   String   Sets a name for the callback function in a jsonp request


password   String   Sets a password to be used in an HTTP access authentication request.


processData     Boolean value
   Default is true		   whether or not data sent with the request should be transformed into a query string.


scriptCharset   String   Sets the charset for the request


success(result,status,xhr)   function   run when the request succeeds


timeout   Number   The local timeout in milliseconds for the request


traditional   Boolean value   whether or not to use the traditional style of param serialization


type    String      
   (GET or POST)		   Sets the type of request.


url   String   Sets the URL to send the request to.
      Default is the current page      


username   String   Sets a username to be used in an HTTP access authentication request


xhr   function   for creating the XMLHttpRequest object




Example

Use the error setting to specify an error handler for AJAX requests.

$(document).ready(function(){
  $("button").click(function(){
    $.ajaxSetup({url:"wrongfile.txt",error:function(xhr){
        document.getElementById('demo').innerHTML = 
             "An error occured: " + xhr.status + " " + xhr.statusText;
    }});
  $.ajax();
  });
});


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script 
src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!--   ww    w  .d    e  m o 2  s   . c  o    m-->
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  $("button").click(function(){
    $.ajaxSetup({url:"wrongfile.txt",error:function(xhr){
        document.getElementById('demo').innerHTML = 
             "An error occured: " + xhr.status + " " + xhr.statusText;
    }});
  $.ajax();
  });
});
</script>
</head>
<body>
<p id='demo'></p>
<div></div>

<button>Run</button>

</body>
</html>




jQuery ajaxStart() Method



Example

Show a "loading" indicator image when an AJAX request starts:

$(document).ready(function(){
  $(document).ajaxStart(function(){
    $(this).html("<img src='css.png'>");
  });
  $("button").click(function(){
    $("div").load("ajax.txt");
  });
});


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script 
src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!-- w    w  w  .d  e   m  o 2  s    .c  o  m  -->
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  $(document).ajaxStart(function(){
    $(this).html("<img src='css.png'>");
  });
  $("button").click(function(){
    $("div").load("ajax.txt");
  });
});
</script>
</head>
<body>

<div><h3>Let AJAX change this text</h3></div>

<button>Change Content</button>

</body>
</html>



Description

The ajaxStart() method run a function when an AJAX request starts.

This method should attach to document node.


Syntax


$(document).ajaxStart(function())




Parameter   Description


function()   Required.                                            
   Sets the function to run when the AJAX request starts



jQuery ajaxStop() Method



Example

Trigger an alert box when all AJAX requests have completed:

$(document).ready(function(){
  $(document).ajaxStop(function(){
    document.getElementById('demo').innerHTML = "All AJAX requests completed";
  });
  $("button").click(function(){
    $("div").load("ajax.txt");
    $("div").load("ajax.txt");
    $("div").load("ajax.txt");
    $("div").load("ajax.txt");
    $("div").load("ajax.txt");
  });
});


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script 
src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!--  w w  w   .   d  e m  o   2s  .   c  o   m-->
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  $(document).ajaxStop(function(){
    document.getElementById('demo').innerHTML = "All AJAX requests completed";
  });
  $("button").click(function(){
    $("div").load("ajax.txt");
    $("div").load("ajax.txt");
    $("div").load("ajax.txt");
    $("div").load("ajax.txt");
    $("div").load("ajax.txt");
  });
});
</script>
</head>
<body>
<p id='demo'></p>
<div><h3>Let AJAX change this text</h3></div>

<button>Change Content</button>

</body>
</html>



Description

The ajaxStop() method run a function when ALL AJAX requests have completed.

When an AJAX request completes, jQuery checks if there are any more AJAX requests. 

The function specified with the ajaxStop() method will run if no other requests are 
pending.

This method should only be attached to document.


Syntax


$(document).ajaxStop(function())




Parameter   Description


function()   Required.                                                     
   Sets the function to run when all AJAX requests have completed



jQuery ajaxSuccess() Method



Example

Trigger an alert box when an AJAX request completes successfully:

$(document).ready(function(){
  $(document).ajaxSuccess(function(){
    document.getElementById('demo').innerHTML = 
        "AJAX request successfully completed";
  });
  $("button").click(function(){
    $("div").load("ajax.txt");
  });
});


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script 
src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!-- w    w  w.   d   e  m  o2  s  .    co    m-->
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  $(document).ajaxSuccess(function(){
    document.getElementById('demo').innerHTML = 
        "AJAX request successfully completed";
  });
  $("button").click(function(){
    $("div").load("ajax.txt");
  });
});
</script>
</head>
<body>
<p id='demo'></p>
<div><h3>Let AJAX change this text</h3></div>

<button>Change Content</button>

</body>
</html>



Description

The ajaxSuccess() method runs a function when an AJAX request is successfully completed.

This method should attach to document.


Syntax


$(document).ajaxSuccess(function(event,xhr,options))




Parameter   Description


function(event,xhr,options)   Required.                                       
   Sets the function to run if the request succeeds

Additional parameters: 




Item   Description



event   the event object


xhr   the XMLHttpRequest object


options   the options used in the AJAX request




Example


$(document).ready(function(){
  $(document).ajaxSuccess(function(e, xhr, opt){
    if (opt.url == "ajax.txt") {
        document.getElementById('demo').innerHTML =  
                "AJAX request successfully completed");
    };
  });
  $("button").click(function(){
    $("div").load("ajax.txt");
  });
});


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script 
src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!--   w w w  .  d    e m   o  2  s .  c   om  -->
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  $(document).ajaxSuccess(function(e, xhr, opt){
    if (opt.url == "ajax.txt") {
        document.getElementById('demo').innerHTML =  
                "AJAX request successfully completed");
    };
  });
  $("button").click(function(){
    $("div").load("ajax.txt");
  });
});
</script>
</head>
<body>
<p id='demo'></p>
<div><h3>Let AJAX change this text</h3></div>

<button>Change Content</button>

</body>
</html>




jQuery animate() Method



Example

"Animate" an element, by changing its height:

$(document).ready(function(){
  $("#btn1").click(function(){
    $("#box").animate({height: "300px"});
  });
  $("#btn2").click(function(){
    $("#box").animate({height: "100px"});
  });
});


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script 
src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!--  w  w  w .   d e   m o    2 s .   c o  m  -->
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  $("#btn1").click(function(){
    $("#box").animate({height: "300px"});
  });
  $("#btn2").click(function(){
    $("#box").animate({height: "100px"});
  });
});
</script>
</head>
<body>

<button id="btn1">Animate height</button>
<button id="btn2">Reset height</button>

<div id="box" 
     style="background:#98bf21;height:100px;width:100px;margin:6px;"></div>

</body>
</html>



Description

The animate() method can animate on a set of CSS properties.

This method changes an element from one state to another with CSS styles. 

The CSS property value is changed gradually, to create an animated effect.

Only numeric values can be animated, for example "margin:30px". 

String values cannot be animated, for example "background-color:red", 
except for the strings "show", "hide" and "toggle". 

These values allow hiding and showing the animated element.

Use "+=" or "-=" for relative animations.


Syntax


(selector).animate({styles},speed,easing,callback)




Parameter   Description



styles


   Required.                                                                                                                                                                                    
   Sets one or more CSS properties/values to animate.                                                                                                                                           
   Note: The property names must be camel-cased when used with the animate() method: You will need to write paddingLeft instead of padding-left, marginRight instead of margin-right, and so on.
   Only numeric values can be animated (like "margin:30px").                                                                                                                                    
   String values cannot be animated (like "background-color:red"), except for the strings "show", "hide" and "toggle".                                                                          
   These values allow hiding and showing the animated element.                                                                                                                                  


speed



   Optional.                               
   Sets the speed of the animation.        
   Default value is 400 milliseconds       
   Possible values:                        
   milliseconds (like 100, 1000, 5000, etc)
   "slow"                                  
   "fast"                                  


easing   Optional.                                                          
   Sets the speed of the element in different points of the animation.
   Default value is "swing".                                          


callback   Optional.                                               
   A function to be executed after the animation completes.



easing possible values: 




Item   Description



"swing"   moves slower at the beginning/end, but faster in the middle


"linear"   moves in a constant speed



Properties that can be animated:

backgroundPositionX
backgroundPositionY
borderWidth
borderBottomWidth
borderLeftWidth
borderRightWidth
borderTopWidth
borderSpacing
margin
marginBottom
marginLeft
marginRight
marginTop
opacity
outlineWidth
padding
paddingBottom
paddingLeft
paddingRight
paddingTop
height
width
maxHeight
maxWidth
minHeight
minWidth
fontSize
bottom
left
right
top
letterSpacing
wordSpacing
lineHeight
textIndent


Alternate Syntax


(selector).animate({styles},{options})




Parameter   Description



styles   Required.                                        
   Sets one or more CSS properties/values to animate


options   Optional.                                 
   Sets additional options for the animation.



options possible values: 




Item   Description



duration   sets the speed of the animation


easing   specifies the easing function to use


complete   specifies a function to be executed after the animation completes


step   specifies a function to be executed for each step in the animation


progress   specifies a function to be executed after each step in the animation


queue   a Boolean value specifying whether or not to place the animation in the effects queue


specialEasing   a map of one or more CSS properties from the styles parameter, and their corresponding easing functions


start   specifies a function to be executed when the animation begins


done   specifies a function to be executed when the animation ends


fail   specifies a function to be executed if the animation fails to complete


always   specifies a function to be executed if the animation stops without completing




Example

use animate() with a callback function that repeats the animation.

$(document).ready(function(){
  $("button").click(function(){
    let div = $("div");
    startAnimation();
    function startAnimation(){
      div.animate({height: 300}, "slow");
      div.animate({width: 300}, "slow");
      div.css("background-color", "blue");
      div.animate({height: 100}, "slow");
      div.animate({width: 100}, "slow", startAnimation);
    }
  });
});


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script 
src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!--  w   w  w.    d e  m o  2  s  .  c   o m  -->
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  $("button").click(function(){
    let div = $("div");
    startAnimation();
    function startAnimation(){
      div.animate({height: 300}, "slow");
      div.animate({width: 300}, "slow");
      div.css("background-color", "blue");
      div.animate({height: 100}, "slow");
      div.animate({width: 100}, "slow", startAnimation);
    }
  });
});
</script>
</head>
<body>

<button>Start Animation</button>

<div style="width:50px;height:50px;
            position:absolute;left:10px;top:50px;background-color:red;"></div>

</body>
</html>


Using the alternate syntax to specify multiple animation styles and options.

$(document).ready(function(){
  $("#btn").click(function(){
    $("#box").animate({
      height: "300px",
      width: "300px"
    }, {
      duration: 5000,
      easing: "linear",
      complete: function(){
      $(this).after("<p>Animation is complete!</p>");
      }
    });
  });
});


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script 
src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!-- w    w  w .   d e  m o  2  s   . c  o    m-->
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  $("#btn").click(function(){
    $("#box").animate({
      height: "300px",
      width: "300px"
    }, {
      duration: 5000,
      easing: "linear",
      complete: function(){
      $(this).after("<p>Animation is complete!</p>");
      }
    });
  });
});
</script>
</head>
<body>

<button id="btn">Animate height & width</button>

<div id="box" 
style="background:#98bf21;height:100px;
width:100px;margin:6px;"></div>

</body>
</html>


use the animate() method to create a progress bar.

$(document).ready(function(){
  $("#btn").click(function(){
    $("#box").animate({
      width: "400px"
    }, {
      duration: 5000,
      easing: "linear",
      step: function(x) {
        $("#demo").text(Math.round(x * 100 / 400)  + "%");
      }
    });
  });
});


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script 
src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!-- w  w    w.    d  e m   o2    s  .  c  o m -->
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  $("#btn").click(function(){
    $("#box").animate({
      width: "400px"
    }, {
      duration: 5000,
      easing: "linear",
      step: function(x) {
        $("#demo").text(Math.round(x * 100 / 400)  + "%");
      }
    });
  });
});
</script>
</head>
<body>

<button id="btn">Start Progress Bar</button>

<div style="border:1px solid green;margin:10px;width:400px;">
  <div id="box" style="background:#98bf21;height:50px;width:1px;
                       border:1px solid green;"></div>
</div>

<p id="demo"></p>

</body>
</html>


use animate() to add smooth scrolling to links.

$(document).ready(function(){
  // Add smooth scrolling to all links
  $("a").on('click', function(event) {

    if (this.hash !== "") {
      // Prevent default anchor click behavior
      event.preventDefault();//   w  w   w .   de   m   o2    s .   c o   m

      // Store hash
      let hash = this.hash;

      $('html, body').animate({
        scrollTop: $(hash).offset().top
      }, 800, function(){

        window.location.hash = hash;
      });
    } // End if
  });
});


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script 
src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!--  w   w  w  . d  e m  o   2 s  .    c  o m -->
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  // Add smooth scrolling to all links
  $("a").on('click', function(event) {

    if (this.hash !== "") {
      // Prevent default anchor click behavior
      event.preventDefault();

      // Store hash
      let hash = this.hash;

      $('html, body').animate({
        scrollTop: $(hash).offset().top
      }, 800, function(){

        window.location.hash = hash;
      });
    } // End if
  });
});
</script>
 <style>
body, html, .main {
  height: 100%;
}

section {
  min-height: 100%;
}
</style>
</head>
<body>

<a href="#section2">Click Me to Smooth Scroll to Section 2 Below</a>

<div class="main">
  <section></section>
</div>

<div class="main" id="section2">
  <section style="background-color:blue"></section>
</div>

</body>
</html>




jQuery append() Method



Example

Insert content at the end of all <p> elements:

$(document).ready(function(){
  $("#btn1").click(function(){
    $("p").append(" <b>Appended text</b>.");
  });
  $("#btn2").click(function(){
    $("ol").append("<li>Appended item</li>");
  });
});


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script 
src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!--   w  ww   .   d  em  o    2  s.  c  o  m  -->
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  $("#btn1").click(function(){
    $("p").append(" <b>Appended text</b>.");
  });
  $("#btn2").click(function(){
    $("ol").append("<li>Appended item</li>");
  });
});
</script>
</head>
<body>

<p>This is a paragraph.</p>
<p>This is another paragraph.</p>

<ol>
  <li>List item 1</li>
  <li>List item 2</li>
  <li>List item 3</li>
</ol>

<button id="btn1">Append text</button>
<button id="btn2">Append list item</button>

</body>
</html>



Description

The append() method inserts specified content at the end of the selected elements.

To insert content at the beginning of the selected elements, use the prepend() method.


Syntax


$(selector).append(content,function(index,html))




Parameter   Description



content


   Required.                                    
   the content to insert, for example, HTML tags
   Possible values:                             
   HTML elements                                
   jQuery objects                               
   DOM elements                                 


function(index,html)   Optional.                                    
   a function that returns the content to insert



function(index,html) has the following parameters:




Item   Description



index   Returns the index position of the element in the set


html   Returns the current HTML of the selected element




Example

Insert content with the append() method.

function appendText() {
  let txt1 = "<p>Text.</p>";        // Create text with HTML
  let txt2 = $("<p></p>").text("Text.");  // Create text with jQuery
  let txt3 = document.createElement("p");
  txt3.innerHTML = "Text.";         // Create text with DOM
  $("body").append(txt1, txt2, txt3);   // Append new elements
}


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script 
src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!--  w   ww    .d   e m    o  2  s .  c  o  m -->
<script>
function appendText() {
  let txt1 = "<p>Text.</p>";        // Create text with HTML
  let txt2 = $("<p></p>").text("Text.");  // Create text with jQuery
  let txt3 = document.createElement("p");
  txt3.innerHTML = "Text.";         // Create text with DOM
  $("body").append(txt1, txt2, txt3);   // Append new elements
}
</script>
</head>
<body>

<p>This is a paragraph.</p>
<button onclick="appendText()">Append text</button>

</body>
</html>


Using a function to insert content at the end of the selected elements.

$(document).ready(function(){
  $("button").click(function(){
    $("p").append(function(n){
      return "<b>This p element has index " + n + ".</b>";
    });
  });
});


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script 
src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!-- w  w    w.   d   e  m o   2  s.    c o m  -->
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  $("button").click(function(){
    $("p").append(function(n){
      return "<b>This p element has index " + n + ".</b>";
    });
  });
});
</script>
</head>
<body>

<h1>This is a heading</h1>

<p>This is a paragraph.</p>
<p>This is another paragraph.</p>

<button>Insert content at the end of each p element</button>

</body>
</html>




jQuery appendTo() Method



Example

Insert a <span> element at the end of each <p> element:

$(document).ready(function(){
  $("button").click(function(){
    $("<span>Hello World!</span>").appendTo("p");
  });
});


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script 
src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!--   w w   w  .  d  e m o  2   s  .   c  o m -->
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  $("button").click(function(){
    $("<span>Hello World!</span>").appendTo("p");
  });
});
</script>
</head>
<body>

<button>Insert span element at the end of each p element</button>

<p>This is a paragraph.</p>
<p>This is another paragraph.</p>

</body>
</html>



Description

The appendTo() method inserts HTML elements at the end of the selected elements.

To insert HTML elements at the beginning of the selected elements, 
use the prependTo() method.


Syntax


$(content).appendTo(selector)




Parameter   Description



content   Required.                                      
   the content to insert (must contain HTML tags).


selector   Required.                                 
   on which elements to append the content to



If content is an existing element, it will be moved from its current position, 
and inserted at the end of the selected elements.


Example

Use the appendTo() method to insert an existing element at the end of each selected element.

Move and insert the h1 element at the end of each p element

$(document).ready(function(){
  $("button").click(function(){
    $("h1").appendTo("p");
  });
});


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script 
src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!-- w   w w    .d  e  m   o   2 s  .   c  o  m-->
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  $("button").click(function(){
    $("h1").appendTo("p");
  });
});
</script>
</head>
<body>

<h1>This is a heading</h1>

<p>This is a paragraph.</p>
<p>This is another paragraph.</p>

<button>test</button>

</body>
</html>




jQuery attr() Method



Example

Set the width attribute of an image:

$(document).ready(function(){
  $("button").click(function(){
    $("img").attr("width", "500");
  });
});


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script 
src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!--   w  ww   .   d  e  mo   2   s.    c  om  -->
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  $("button").click(function(){
    $("img").attr("width", "500");
  });
});
</script>
</head>
<body>

<img src="css.png" alt="css png" width="284" height="213"><br>

<button>Set the width attribute of the image</button>

</body>
</html>



Description

The attr() method sets or gets attributes and values of the selected elements.

When getting the attribute value, it returns the value of the first matched element.

When setting the attribute values, it sets one or more attribute/value pairs for the set of matched elements.


Syntax

Return the value of an attribute:

$(selector).attr(attribute)

Set the attribute and value:

$(selector).attr(attribute,value)

Set attribute and value using a function:

$(selector).attr(attribute,function(index,current_value))

Set multiple attributes and values:

$(selector).attr({attribute:value,attribute:value,...})




Parameter   Description



attribute   the name of the attribute


value   the value of the attribute


function(index,current_value)   a function that returns the attribute value to set



function(index,current_value) has the following parameters:




Item   Description



index   Receives the index position of the element in the set


current_value   Receives the current attribute value of selected elements




Example

Return the value of an attribute for an element.

$(document).ready(function(){
  $("button").click(function(){
    document.getElementById('demo').innerHTML = 
          "Image width: " + $("img").attr("width");
  });
});


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script 
src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!-- w   w w   .   de  m  o  2    s  .  c o m  -->
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  $("button").click(function(){
    document.getElementById('demo').innerHTML = 
          "Image width: " + $("img").attr("width");
  });
});
</script>
</head>
<body>
<p id='demo'></p>
<img src="css.png" alt="css png" width="284" height="213"><br>

<button>Return the width of the image</button>

</body>
</html>


Use a function to set the attribute value for an element.

Decrease image width by 50px.

$(document).ready(function(){
  $("button").click(function(){
    $("img").attr("width",function(n, v){
      return v - 50;
    });
  });
});


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script 
src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!--   w w   w  . d  e   m o   2  s  .c  o   m -->
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  $("button").click(function(){
    $("img").attr("width",function(n, v){
      return v - 50;
    });
  });
});
</script>
</head>
<body>

<img src="css.png" alt="css png" width="284" height="213"><br>

<button>test</button>

</body>
</html>


Set multiple attributes/values for an element.

$(document).ready(function(){
  $("button").click(function(){
    $("img").attr({width: "150", height: "100"});
  });
});


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script 
src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!--   w w  w  .   de   m o  2  s    . c   o  m-->
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  $("button").click(function(){
    $("img").attr({width: "150", height: "100"});
  });
});
</script>
</head>
<body>

<img src="css.png" alt="css png" width="284" height="213"><br>

<button>Set width and height attributes of the image</button>

</body>
</html>




jQuery before() Method



Example

Insert content before each <p> element:

$(document).ready(function(){
  $("button").click(function(){
    $("p").before("<p>Hello world!</p>");
  });
});


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script 
src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!-- w   w   w  . d e   m  o 2   s  .   c o  m -->
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  $("button").click(function(){
    $("p").before("<p>Hello world!</p>");
  });
});
</script>
</head>
<body>

<button>Insert content before each p element</button>

<p>This is a paragraph.</p>
<p>This is a paragraph.</p>

</body>
</html>



Description

The before() method inserts specified content in front of the selected elements.

To insert content after selected elements, use the after() method.


Syntax


$(selector).before(content,function(index))




Parameter   Description



content

   the content to insert, can contain HTML tags
   Possible values:                            
   HTML elements                               
   jQuery objects                              
   DOM elements                                


function(index)   Optional.                                                   
   a function that returns the content to insert               
   index - Returns the index position of the element in the set




Example

Insert content with the before() method.

function beforeText() {
  let txt1 = "<b>I </b>";          // Create element with HTML
  let txt2 = $("<i></i>").text("love ");   // Create with jQuery
  let txt3 = document.createElement("b");  // Create with DOM
  txt3.innerHTML = "jQuery!";
  $("img").before(txt1, txt2, txt3);  // Insert new elements before img
}


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script 
src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!-- w   w   w  .  d e m  o   2 s    .c  o  m  -->
<script>
function beforeText() {
  let txt1 = "<b>I </b>";          // Create element with HTML
  let txt2 = $("<i></i>").text("love ");   // Create with jQuery
  let txt3 = document.createElement("b");  // Create with DOM
  txt3.innerHTML = "jQuery!";
  $("img").before(txt1, txt2, txt3);  // Insert new elements before img
}
</script>
</head>
<body>

<img src="html.png" alt="jQuery" width="100" height="140">

<p>Click the button to insert text before the image.</p>

<button onclick="beforeText()">Insert before</button>

</body>
</html>


Use a function to insert content before selected elements.

Insert content before each p element

$(document).ready(function(){
  $("button").click(function(){
    $("p").before(function(n){
      return "<div>The p element below has index " + n + ".</div>";
    });
  });
});


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script 
src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!--   w  w w .    d  em   o   2 s  . c   o   m-->
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  $("button").click(function(){
    $("p").before(function(n){
      return "<div>The p element below has index " + n + ".</div>";
    });
  });
});
</script>
</head>
<body>

<h1>This is a heading</h1>

<p>This is a paragraph.</p>
<p>This is another paragraph.</p>
<p>This is another paragraph.</p>

<button>Test</button>

</body>
</html>




jQuery bind() Method



Example

Attach a click event to the <p> element:

$(document).ready(function(){
  $("p").bind("click", function(){
    document.getElementById('demo').innerHTML = 
             "The paragraph was clicked.";
  });
});


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script 
src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!-- w    w w   .  de  m   o  2  s .    c  o  m-->
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  $("p").bind("click", function(){
    document.getElementById('demo').innerHTML = 
             "The paragraph was clicked.";
  });
});
</script>
</head>
<body>
<p id='demo'></p>
<p>Click me!</p>

</body>
</html>



Description

The bind() method was deprecated in version 3.0. Use the on() method instead.

The bind() method attaches one or more event handlers for selected elements, 
and specifies a function to run when the event occurs.


Syntax


$(selector).bind(event,data,function,map)




Parameter   Description



event
   Required.                                    
   one or more events to attach to the elements.
   Multiple event values are separated by space.
   Must be a valid event.                       


data   Optional.                                    
   additional data to pass along to the function


function   Required.                                
   the function to run when the event occurs


map   an event map ({event:function, event:function, ...})        
   containing one or more events to attach to the elements, and
   functions to run when the event occurs                      




Example

Attach multiple events to an element.

$(document).ready(function(){
  $("p").bind("mouseover mouseout", function(){
    $("p").toggleClass("intro");
  });
});


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script 
src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!--  w  w   w  .d  e  m   o  2  s  . c    o  m-->
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  $("p").bind("mouseover mouseout", function(){
    $("p").toggleClass("intro");
  });
});
</script>
<style>
.intro {
  font-size: 150%;
  color: red;
}
</style>
</head>
<body>

<p>Hover the mouse pointer over this paragraph.</p>

</body>
</html>


Use an event map to attach several events/functions to the selected elements.

$(document).ready(function(){
  $("button").bind({
    click:function(){$("p").slideToggle();},
    mouseover:function(){$("body").css("background-color", "#E9E9E4");},
    mouseout:function(){$("body").css("background-color", "#FFFFFF");}
  });
});


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script 
src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!-- w    ww    . d   e m  o   2s  .    co   m -->
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  $("button").bind({
    click:function(){$("p").slideToggle();},
    mouseover:function(){$("body").css("background-color", "#E9E9E4");},
    mouseout:function(){$("body").css("background-color", "#FFFFFF");}
  });
});
</script>
</head>
<body>

<p>This is a paragraph.</p>

<button>Click me!</button>

</body>
</html>


Pass along data to a custom named event handler.

function handlerName(e){
  document.getElementById('demo').innerHTML = 
    e.data.msg;
}

$(document).ready(function(){
  $("p").bind("click", {msg: "You just clicked me!"}, handlerName)
});


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script 
src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!--  w   ww    .d   e   m o   2  s . c   o  m -->
<script>
function handlerName(e){
  document.getElementById('demo').innerHTML = 
    e.data.msg;
}

$(document).ready(function(){
  $("p").bind("click", {msg: "You just clicked me!"}, handlerName)
});
</script>
</head>
<body>
<p id='demo'></p>
<p>Click me!</p>

</body>
</html>




jQuery blur() Method



Example

Attach a function to the blur event. 

The blur event occurs when the <input> field loses focus:

$(document).ready(function(){
  $("input").blur(function(){
      document.getElementById('demo').innerHTML = 
         "This input field has lost its focus.";
  });
});


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script 
src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!-- w  w    w . d    e  mo  2    s  .  c o   m-->
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  $("input").blur(function(){
      document.getElementById('demo').innerHTML = 
         "This input field has lost its focus.";
  });
});
</script>
</head>
<body>
<p id='demo'></p>
Enter your name: <input type="text">
<p>Write something in the input field, 
and then click outside the field to lose focus (blur).
</p>
</body>
</html>



Description

The blur event occurs when an element loses focus.

The blur() method triggers the blur event, or runs a function when a blur event occurs.

This method is often used together with the focus() method.


Syntax

Trigger the blur event for the selected elements:

$(selector).blur()

Example

$(document).ready(function(){
  $("#btn1").click(function(){
    $("input").focus();
    $("p").html("focus event triggered");
  });
  $("#btn2").click(function(){
    $("input").blur();
    $("p").html("blur event triggered");
  });
});


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script 
src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!-- w  w    w.    de   m o    2s   .  c   o m -->
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  $("#btn1").click(function(){
    $("input").focus();
    $("p").html("focus event triggered");
  });
  $("#btn2").click(function(){
    $("input").blur();
    $("p").html("blur event triggered");
  });
});
</script>
</head>
<body>

Enter your name: <input type="text">
<br><br>

<button id="btn1">Trigger focus event</button>
<button id="btn2">Trigger blur event</button>

<p style="color:red"></p>

</body>
</html>


Attach a function to the blur event:

$(selector).blur(function)

Example

$(document).ready(function(){
  $("input").focus(function(){
    $(this).css("background-color", "#cccccc");
  });
  $("input").blur(function(){
    $(this).css("background-color", "#ffffff");
  });
});


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script 
src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!-- w    w w .   d e    m  o  2  s .  c  o  m -->
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  $("input").focus(function(){
    $(this).css("background-color", "#cccccc");
  });
  $("input").blur(function(){
    $(this).css("background-color", "#ffffff");
  });
});
</script>
</head>
<body>

Name: <input type="text" name="fullname"><br>
Email: <input type="text" name="email">

</body>
</html>





Parameter   Description


function   Optional.                                     
   the function to run when the blur event occurs



jQuery change() Method



Example

Alert a text when an <input> field is changed:

Write something in the input field, 
and then press enter or click outside the field.

$(document).ready(function(){
  $("input").change(function(){
    document.getElementById('demo').innerHTML = 
       "The text has been changed.";
  });
});


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script 
src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!--  w  w  w .    d  em   o 2  s    .  c o   m-->
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  $("input").change(function(){
    document.getElementById('demo').innerHTML = 
       "The text has been changed.";
  });
});
</script>
</head>
<body>
<p id='demo'></p>
<input type="text">

</body>
</html>



Description

The change event occurs when the value of an element has been changed.

The change event only works on <input>, <textarea> and <select> elements.

The change() method triggers the change event, or run a function when a change event occurs.

For select menus, the change event occurs when an option is selected. 

For text fields or text areas, the change event occurs when the field loses focus, 
after the content has been changed.


Syntax

Trigger the change event for the selected elements:

$(selector).change()

Example

$(document).ready(function(){
  $("button").click(function(){
    $("input").change();
  });
});


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script 
src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!--  w   ww    . d   e m   o 2   s.  c   o   m-->
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  $("button").click(function(){
    $("input").change();
  });
});
</script>
</head>
<body>

<p>Click the button to trigger the change event (even if the element 
has not been changed).</p>

<button>Trigger change event for input field</button>

<p>Enter your name: 
<input value="Javascript" onchange="console.log(this.value)" type="text"></p>

</body>
</html>


Attach a function to the change event:

$(selector).change(function)

Example

$(document).ready(function(){
  $(".field").change(function(){
    $(this).css("background-color", "#D6D6FF");
  });
});


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script 
src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!-- w    w  w.   d e   m  o  2  s  .   c o  m -->
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  $(".field").change(function(){
    $(this).css("background-color", "#D6D6FF");
  });
});
</script>
</head>
<body>

<p>Attach a function to run when an element has been changed:</p>

Enter your name: <input class="field" type="text">
<p>Write something in the input field, and then press enter 
or click outside the field.</p>

Car:
<select class="field" name="languages">
  <option value="css">CSS</option>
  <option value="html">HTML<</option>
  <option value="javascript">Javascript<</option>
  <option value="sql">SQL<</option>
</select>

<p>Select an option in the drop-down list.</p>

</body>
</html>





Parameter   Description


function   Optional.                                                                 
   the function to run when the change event occurs for the selected elements



jQuery children() Method



Example

Return elements that are direct children of <ul>:

$(document).ready(function(){
  $("ul").children().css({"color": "red", "border": "2px solid red"});
});


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<style>
.descendants * {<!--   w w w    . d  e   m  o  2 s   .  c  om  -->
  display: block;
  border: 2px solid lightgrey;
  color: lightgrey;
  padding: 5px;
  margin: 15px;
}
</style>
<script 
src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script>
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  $("ul").children().css({"color": "red", "border": "2px solid red"});
});
</script>
</head>

<body class="descendants">body (great-grandparent)
  <div style="width:500px;">div (grandparent)
    <ul>ul (direct parent)
      <li>li (child)
        <span>span (grandchild)</span>
      </li>
    </ul>
  </div>
</body>

</html>



Description

The children() method returns all direct children of the selected element.

This method only traverse a single level down the DOM tree. 

To traverse down multiple levels to get grand children or other descendants, 
use the find() method.

To traverse a single level up the DOM tree, or all the way up to the document's root 
element to get parents or other ancestors, use the parent() or parents() method.

This method does not return text nodes. 

To return all children including text nodes, use the contents() method.


Syntax


$(selector).children(filter)




Parameter   Description


filter   Optional.                                                   
   a selector expression to narrow down the search for children


Example

Get all direct children of an <ul> element.

$("ul").children().css({"color": "red", "border": "2px solid red"});


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<style>
.descendants * {<!--  w  w  w  .  d  e  m   o2    s  . c o    m-->
  display: block;
  border: 2px solid lightgrey;
  color: lightgrey;
  padding: 5px;
  margin: 15px;
}
</style>
<script 
src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script>
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  $("ul").children().css({"color": "red", "border": "2px solid red"});
});
</script>
</head>

<body class="descendants">body (great-grandparent)
  <div style="width:500px;">div (grandparent)
    <ul>ul (direct parent)
      <li>li (child)
        <span>span (grandchild)</span>
      </li>
      <li>li (child)
        <span>span (grandchild)</span>
      </li>
    </ul>
  </div>
</body>

</html>


To narrow down the search using selector

Use the filter parameter to return all <li> elements with the class name "first", 
that are direct children of <ul>.

$("ul").children("li.first").css({"color": "red", "border": "2px solid red"});


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<style>
.descendants * {<!--   w w w   .   de  m   o   2  s.  c  o   m -->
  display: block;
  border: 2px solid lightgrey;
  color: lightgrey;
  padding: 5px;
  margin: 15px;
}
</style>
<script 
src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script>
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  $("ul").children("li.first").css({"color": "red", "border": "2px solid red"});
});
</script>
</head>

<body class="descendants">body (great-grandparent)
  <div style="width:500px;">div (grandparent)
    <ul>ul (direct parent)
      <li class="first">li (child)
        <span>span (grandchild)</span>
      </li>
      <li class="second">li (child)
        <span>span (grandchild)</span>
      </li>
    </ul>
  </div>
</body>

</html>


Select all <p> elements that are direct children of their parent <div> element.

$("div").children("p").css("background-color", "yellow");


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script 
src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!--   ww  w   .   d e m   o  2 s  .   c   o m -->
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  $("div").children("p").css("background-color", "yellow");
});
</script>
</head>
<body>

<p>This is a p element in body.</p>

<div style="border:1px solid;">
  <p>This is a p element (child of div).</p>
  <h4>This is a h4 element inside the div (child of div).</h4>
  <p class="child">This is a p element with class "child" (child of div).</p>
  <span>This is a span element (child of div).</span>
  <p>This is also a p element (child of div).</p>
</div>

<p>This is also a p element in body.</p>

</body>
</html>


Show the descendants of an element by tag names

The following example shows what are the descendants of a <div> element.

In this example, $("div").children will only return P, and not P + SPAN, 
because children() only traverse a single level down the DOM tree.

$(document).ready(function(){
  let treeTraversal = $("div").children().map(function(){
  return this.tagName;}).get().join(", ");
  $("div").after("<h3>" + treeTraversal + "<h3>");
});


Open in separate window
View full source code

<html>
<head>
<script 
src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js">
</script><!--  w   ww   .   de   m   o2   s   .  co   m -->
<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
  let treeTraversal = $("div").children().map(function(){
  return this.tagName;}).get().join(", ");
  $("div").after("<h3>" + treeTraversal + "<h3>");
});
</script>
</head>

<body>
  <div> This is a div element. My child is:
    <p>
      <span></span>
    </p>
  </div>
</body>
</html>
